thread.title: British Airways' bigger Dreamliners will make their debut on route to Delhi in autumn
thread.title_full: British Airways' bigger Dreamliners will make their debut on route to Delhi in autumn - Mirror Online

author: By Nigel Thompson
title: British Airways' bigger Dreamliners will make their debut on route to Delhi in autumn
text:
Delhi is the first destination for British Airways ' new stretched jetlag-busting Dreamliner.
The flag carrier will fly to the Indian capital five times a week on the bigger Boeing 787-9 from October 25.
At 20ft longer than its 787-8 predecessor - of which BA has eight – there's now room for the airline's elite new first class cabin, which is not on the smaller planes.
The 'turn left' section will feature suites with personal wardrobe space, device chargers, a new seat and in-flight entertainment handset and bespoke soft leather and fabric trim. And of course some of the best food and drink in the skies.
Lead-in economy return fares to Delhi start from £632.
Next up for the longer 787 is Abu Dhabi and Muscat - a combined flight - and Kuala Lumpur . BA will eventually have 42 Dreamliners.
The revolutionary 787s are made largely from composite material and passengers enjoy a more spacious, airy plane with wider aisles and higher ceilings plus mood lighting and larger windows offering views of the horizon from every seat.
Changes they feel rather than see include moister, cleaner air at a lower cabin pressure - 5-6,000ft rather than the typical 8,000ft - which allows more oxygen to be absorbed into the blood to reduce the chance of dehydration and headaches.
The physical flight is better, too, as 787s offer a smoother, quieter journey thanks to noise-reducing engines and wings that counter turbulence. All those factors combine to help reduce the effects of jetlag.
Nick Morrish/BA Upgrade: British Airways is giving 18 of its Boeing 747 jumbo jets a facelift from September
There's good news for BA passengers on its Boeing 747s too. The airline is upgrading 18 jumbo jets from September with more business class seats - and all cabins get a facelift and a new Panasonic eX3 next generation in-flight entertainment system.
The new system provides more than 130 movies and 400 TV programmes on larger, hi-resolution screens with a tablet-style interface.
Passengers in premium economy will get a universal power socket at every seat, while economy travellers will now have a personal USB socket to power phones and tablets.
Seats in premium economy and economy will get more comfortable foam and covers like those on the new Airbus A380 superjumbo and Dreamliner aircraft, plus the same colour palette for fittings.
The spruced-up planes will operate on selected flights to New York, Chicago, Lagos, Dubai, Boston, Riyadh and Kuwait. ba.com
Winter is coming for Qantas flyers Aussie flag carrier Qantas has teamed with premium TV network HBO to offer passengers smash hit shows such as Game of Thrones and True Detective at 37,000ft.
Old favourites The Sopranos and Sex and The City will also form part of 120 hours of HBO content for customers on the Qantas network, with 20 hours of updated material being added each month.
The investment forms part of a multi-million pound overhaul of its inflight entertainment software and hardware.
Long Wall flight: Qantas passengers can watch Jon Snow in HBO's hit show Game of Thrones
A spokeswoman said: ''A lot of our customers look forward to making the most of the opportunity for some uninterrupted viewing time on board, and for many it’s a chance to catch up with their favourite shows.
“Customer satisfaction with inflight entertainment has hit record levels in recent months, and we plan to keep improving the options available with new features that set Qantas apart.” qantas.com
